Class Image

java.lang.Object
  Image

public class Image
extends java.lang.Object

A model of an image with the proportions width X height

Version:
1.0
Author:
Thomas G. Kristensen

Constructor Summary
Image(int width, int height, java.lang.String title)
          Constructs a new empty image.
Image(java.lang.String filename)
          Creates a new Image object, based on an existing file.
 
Method Summary
 int getHeight()
          Returns the height of the image

          Returns the up to nine neighbours in the neighbourhod of the pixel in position (i, j).
 Pixel getPixel(int i, int j)
          Returns the pixel in position (i, j).
 java.util.List<Pixel> getPixels()
          Returns a list of all the pixels in the image

          Returns the width of the image
 void pixelsUpdated()
          Informs the image that one or more of its pixels has changed value, and that it is time to repaint the canvas.

Constructor Detail

Image

public Image(int width,
             int height,
             java.lang.String title)
Constructs a new empty image. Constructs all of the pixels in the image as well.

Parameters:
width - The width of the image
height - The height of the image
title - The title of the image

Image

public Image(java.lang.String filename)
Creates a new Image object, based on an existing file. The title of the image is taken from the filename.

Parameters:
filename - The file to be loaded. Can be a JPG, PNG, BMP or GIF
Method Detail

getHeight

public int getHeight()
Returns the height of the image

Returns:
The height of the image

getNeighbours

public java.util.List<Pixel> getNeighbours(int i,
                                           int j)
Returns the up to nine neighbours in the neighbourhod of the pixel in position (i, j).

Parameters:
i - The horizontal index
j - The vertical index

getPixel

public Pixel getPixel(int i,
                      int j)
Returns the pixel in position (i, j). If the position (i, j) is outside the image, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
i - The horizontal index
j - The vertical index

getPixels

public java.util.List<Pixel> getPixels()
Returns a list of all the pixels in the image

Returns:
A list of all the pixels in the image.

getWidth

public int getWidth()
Returns the width of the image

Returns:
The width of the image

pixelsUpdated

public void pixelsUpdated()
Informs the image that one or more of its pixels has changed value, and that it is time to repaint the canvas.
